Ric Wang Poh PengLevel 2. RookieAnswered on 12 Jun 2018Depends on which stage of life you are at.​if you have no use of them to get property or any potential loans for children’s education.​You can then proceed to use them for investment purposes.0 comments0

Gabriel ThamLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 11 Jun 2018Depends on your strategy and how profitable you are. I would use CPF as my bond component in my portfolio because of the risk free interest rate. I guess the question is, can you generate better returns than CPF consistently every year, without taking on much risk? ​​0 comments0
